title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0009

segments.en: Hello, English learners, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 你好，英语学习者，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
And I'm Erika.
Erika, today we are really excited, right?
segments.cn: Erika，今天我们真的很兴奋，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, we've got a great lesson today all about real English.
segments.cn: 是的，今天我们有一节关于真实英语的精彩课程。

segments.en: Exactly.
English that you hear in movies and TV shows.
segments.cn: 你在电影和电视节目中听到的英语。

segments.en: Yeah, speaking of movies, today's podcast takes place at the movies.
segments.cn: 是的，说到电影，今天的播客发生在电影院。

segments.en: Exactly.
And that's why it's so fun today.
segments.cn: 这就是今天如此有趣的原因。

segments.en: Uh-huh.
Okay, great.
So before we listen to our dialogue, let's take a look at our vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 在我们听对话之前，先看看我们的词汇预览。

segments.en: In today's vocabulary preview, we have two words.
segments.cn: 在今天的词汇预览中，我们有两个单词。

segments.en: And the first word is inconsiderate.
Inconsiderate.
Inconsiderate.
So, Erika, what is it when someone is inconsiderate?
segments.cn: 那么，Erika，当某人不体贴时是什么样的？

segments.en: If someone's inconsiderate, they're not thinking about the feelings of other people.
segments.cn: 如果某人不体贴，他们就不会考虑其他人的感受。

segments.en: Right, so for example, yesterday I was on the subway and it was full.
segments.cn: 对，比如说，昨天我在地铁上，车上满了。

segments.en: Right.
And an old lady was standing there and no one got up to give her their seat.
segments.cn: 一位老太太站在那里，没有人起身让座。

segments.en: That was pretty inconsiderate.
Great, so now let's take a look at our second word, and it's keep it down.
segments.cn: 很好，现在我们来看第二个单词，就是保持安静。

segments.en: Keep it down.
Keep it down.
Keep it down.
So why don't we listen to some examples on how we use keep it down so we can understand.
segments.cn: 那么我们为什么不听一些关于如何使用保持安静的例子，以便理解呢？

segments.en: Excuse me, do you mind keeping it down?
segments.cn: 劳驾，你介意保持安静吗？

segments.en: It's after midnight.
Okay, I'm sorry.
Example two.
I'm trying to study.
Do you mind keeping it down?
Example three.
Do you mind keeping it down?
I'm trying to watch the game.
So that means be quiet.
Yes, don't make so much noise.
segments.cn: 是的，不要发出太多噪音。

segments.en: I used to hear this one all the time from my mother.
segments.cn: 我以前总是听到我母亲说这个。

segments.en: I think we all did when we were children.
segments.cn: 我想我们小时候都听过。

segments.en: Yeah.
Okay, so now let's listen to the dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们来第一次听对话。

segments.en: It's gonna be kind of fast.
But don't worry about it if you can't understand everything.
segments.cn: 但如果你不能理解所有内容也不用担心。

segments.en: By the end of today's lesson, you will understand this dialogue.
segments.cn: 到今天课程结束时，你会理解这个对话。

segments.en: Those people in front of us are making so much noise.
segments.cn: 我们前面的人发出这么大的噪音。

segments.en: It's so inconsiderate.
Don't worry about it.
It's not such a big deal.
I can't hear a thing.
Excuse me.
Can you keep it down?
Sure.
Sorry about that.
Someone's phone is ringing.
Honey, I think it's your phone.
segments.cn: 亲爱的，我想是你的手机。

segments.en: Did you forget to switch it off?
Oh no, you're right.
That's so embarrassing.
Do you mind keeping it down?
I'm trying to watch a movie here.
Well, I hate it when people's phones ring when I'm watching a movie.
segments.cn: 嗯，我讨厌人们在我看电影时手机响。

segments.en: I think everyone gets kind of angry, but we're going to talk about this a little bit later.
segments.cn: 我想每个人都会有点生气，但我们稍后会谈论这个。

segments.en: Why don't we take a look now at our language takeaway?
segments.cn: 我们现在为什么不看看我们的语言要点？

segments.en: Language takeaway.
So the language takeaway is our most important words for today's lesson.
segments.cn: 所以语言要点是我们今天课程中最重要的单词。

segments.en: And our first word today is not such a big deal.
segments.cn: 我们今天的第一个单词是没什么大不了。

segments.en: Not such a big deal.
Not such a big deal.
So when something is not a big deal, it's... Not a big problem.
segments.cn: 当某事没什么大不了时，它是... 不是大问题。

segments.en: It's not important, right?
Exactly.
Okay, let's listen to some examples.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们听一些例子。

segments.en: Example one.
I can't get these files to you by tomorrow.
segments.cn: 我不能在明天之前把这些文件给你。

segments.en: It's okay.
It's not such a big deal.
Example two.
Uh, I'm really sorry.
I'm going to be 10 minutes late for the meeting.
segments.cn: 我会迟到10分钟参加会议。

segments.en: It's not such a big deal.
Peter and Liam are late too.
Now let's look at our second word and it's switch it off.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看第二个单词，就是关掉。

segments.en: Switch it off.
Switch it off.
Switch it off.
So this word means to turn it off.
segments.cn: 这个词的意思是把它关掉。

segments.en: To turn something off.
Now we can use it in three different ways.
segments.cn: 现在我们可以用三种不同的方式使用它。

segments.en: Yeah, this one is a little bit complicated because it changes a little bit depending on how you use it.
segments.cn: 是的，这个有点复杂，因为它的用法会稍有不同。

segments.en: So Marco, I think you've got some examples for us.
segments.cn: 所以Marco，我想你有一些例子给我们。

segments.en: Right, so for example, I can say, Did you switch off your phone?
segments.cn: 对，所以例如，我可以说，你关掉你的手机了吗？

segments.en: Or you could say, Did you switch your phone off?
segments.cn: 或者你可以说，你把手机关掉了吗？

segments.en: Right, or simply you can ask, Did you switch it off?
segments.cn: 对，或者简单地问，你关掉了吗？

segments.en: I think this one is a little bit hard.
Let's look at a couple more examples.
Okay, so I can say, for example, Switch off the TV.
segments.cn: 好的，我可以说，例如，关掉电视。

segments.en: Switch the TV off.
Or switch it off.
Yeah, I think that's a little bit more clear.
segments.cn: 是的，我觉得这样更清楚一些。

segments.en: Yeah.
But you know what, we even had trouble with that one, didn't we?
segments.cn: 但是你知道吗，我们甚至在这个上面也遇到麻烦，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, we had to do it a couple of times.
Okay, now let's look at our last word and it's Can't hear a thing.
segments.cn: 好的，现在让我们看看最后一个词，听不见任何声音。

segments.en: Can't hear a thing.
I can't hear a thing.
Can't hear a thing.
Okay, we have some examples for this phrase, so let's listen.
segments.cn: 好的，我们有一些这个短语的例子，所以让我们听听。

segments.en: Example one.
What's going on in there?
I don't know, I can't hear a thing.
segments.cn: 我不知道，我听不见任何声音。

segments.en: Example two.
What?
I'm sorry, this music is too loud.
I can't hear a thing.
So that's like saying, I can't hear.
segments.cn: 所以这就像是在说，我听不见。

segments.en: Exactly, I can't hear anything.
segments.cn: 正是，我听不见任何东西。

segments.en: It's too loud.
Right, so now we are ready to listen to our dialogue a second time.
segments.cn: 对，所以现在我们准备第二次听我们的对话。

segments.en: It's going to be slower.
This time listen for some of the key words we were explaining.
segments.cn: 这次听听我们解释的一些关键词。

segments.en: Those people in front of us are making so much noise.
segments.cn: 我们面前的人发出这么大的噪音。

segments.en: It's so inconsiderate.
Don't worry about it, it's not such a big deal.
segments.cn: 别担心，这没什么大不了的。

segments.en: I can't hear a thing.
Excuse me, can you keep it down?
Sure, sorry about that.
Someone's phone is ringing.
Honey, I think it's your phone.
segments.cn: 亲爱的，我觉得是你的手机。

segments.en: Did you forget to switch it off?
Oh no, you're right.
That's so embarrassing.
Do you mind keeping it down?
I'm trying to watch a movie here.
Okay, great.
Now with the dialogue slower, it's really understandable.
segments.cn: 现在对话慢了，真的很容易理解。

segments.en: Yeah, I think you could catch those keywords a lot better.
segments.cn: 是的，我觉得你能更好地捕捉到那些关键词。

segments.en: Perfect, so now we are ready to look at putting it together.
segments.cn: 完美，所以现在我们准备把它结合起来。

segments.en: Putting it together.
So in putting it together, we help you use a great phrase in different ways.
segments.cn: 所以在结合起来时，我们帮助你以不同的方式使用一个很好的短语。

segments.en: And today's phrase is, do you mind?
segments.cn: 今天的短语是，你介意吗？

segments.en: Do you mind?
Do you mind?
Okay, so let's listen to some examples on how you can use this phrase in different situations.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们听听一些例子，看看你如何在不同情况下使用这个短语。

segments.en: Example one.
Do you mind holding my coat for me?
segments.cn: 你介意帮我拿一下外套吗？

segments.en: Example two.
Oh, I forgot my wallet.
Do you mind paying for dinner?
Example three.
Do you mind turning off your phone?
segments.cn: 你介意关掉你的手机吗？

segments.en: So this phrase is usually pretty polite.
segments.cn: 所以这个短语通常很礼貌。

segments.en: I could say to you, Marco, do you mind holding my coat for me?
segments.cn: 我可以对你说，马尔科，你介意帮我拿一下外套吗？

segments.en: Then that's really polite.
So would you mind, do you mind are very polite phrases.
segments.cn: 所以你介意吗，您介意吗是非常礼貌的短语。

segments.en: But depending on your voice and how you use your tone, it could be a little bit sarcastic, right?
segments.cn: 但根据你的声音和语调，它可能会有点讽刺，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, it could be a little bit rude if you say, would you mind keeping it down?
segments.cn: 是的，如果你说，你介意小声点吗？可能会有点无礼。

segments.en: Exactly, like we heard in our dialogue.
segments.cn: 正是，就像我们在对话中听到的。

segments.en: Yeah, so that's not so polite.
segments.cn: 是的，所以那样就不太礼貌。

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
I mean, in English, you have to be careful because your tone of voice tells the other person how you're feeling if you're angry, sad, or just like in any other language.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，在英语中，你必须小心，因为你的语调告诉对方你在感受什么，如果你生气、伤心，或者就像在其他语言中一样。

segments.en: Yeah, that's true.
So I mean, using a phrase like, do you mind is a great phrase, but make sure you keep a positive tone in your voice.
segments.cn: 所以我的意思是，使用像你介意吗这样的短语是个好短语，但确保你保持积极的语调。

segments.en: Exactly.
So now that we've talked about all these great things, we can listen to the dialogue a third time, but it'll be at its normal speed.
segments.cn: 所以现在我们谈论了所有这些好东西，我们可以第三次听对话，但会以正常速度进行。

segments.en: Those people in front of us are making so much noise.
segments.cn: 我们面前的人发出这么大的噪音。

segments.en: It's so inconsiderate.
Don't worry about it.
It's not such a big deal.
I can't hear a thing.
Excuse me.
Can you keep it down?
Sure.
Sorry about that.
Someone's phone is ringing.
Honey, I think it's your phone.
segments.cn: 亲爱的，我觉得是你的手机。

segments.en: Did you forget to switch it off?
Oh no, you're right.
That's so embarrassing.
Do you mind keeping it down?
I'm trying to watch a movie here.
So I know that in different countries, there are different habits about watching movies.
segments.cn: 所以我知道在不同国家，看电影有不同的习惯。

segments.en: Yeah, that's definitely true.
Erika, what's it like in Canada?
segments.cn: 艾瑞卡，加拿大是什么样的？

segments.en: Well, in Canada, it's really common to eat popcorn and candy and maybe chips while you're watching a movie.
segments.cn: 嗯，在加拿大，看电影时吃爆米花、糖果和薯片是很常见的。

segments.en: But if your phone rings in the movie theater, this is a big problem.
segments.cn: 但是如果你的手机在电影院响，这就是个大问题。

segments.en: I imagine it is.
I mean, I would be upset also.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，我也会感到不快。

segments.en: What about in Ecuador?
Well, in Ecuador and in South America, usually people can bring in food from the outside.
segments.cn: 嗯，在厄瓜多尔和南美，通常人们可以带外面的食物进来。

segments.en: Really?
Yeah, so it's not really uncommon, depending on the city, to find people bringing in chicken or some sort of like really smelly food.
segments.cn: 是的，所以根据城市的不同，带鸡肉或一些非常臭的食物进来并不罕见。

segments.en: No way!
So you get either really hungry or really upset, but that's what happens.
segments.cn: 所以你要么非常饿，要么非常生气，但这就是发生的事情。

segments.en: You know, I used to live in Switzerland.
segments.cn: 你知道，我曾经住在瑞士。

segments.en: And in Switzerland, you would have to eat before you watch the movie.
segments.cn: 在瑞士，你必须在看电影之前吃东西。

segments.en: There was no popcorn, no soda, no candy inside the movie theater.
segments.cn: 电影院里没有爆米花，没有汽水，没有糖果。

segments.en: Can you imagine that?
I could not live with that because the whole purpose of going to the movies is to have some popcorn and relax and have a good time.
segments.cn: 我无法接受，因为去看电影的目的就是吃点爆米花，放松一下，享受时光。

segments.en: You can't have a movie without popcorn.
segments.cn: 没有爆米花就没有电影。

segments.en: Okay, so we've talked a lot about how to ask someone to be quiet today.
segments.cn: 好吧，今天我们谈了很多关于如何让别人安静的话题。

segments.en: And I hope that you'll go out and try a few of these phrases in your daily life.
segments.cn: 我希望你能在日常生活中尝试这些短语。

segments.en: Yes, and I hope also that you visit our website at EnglishPod.com and leave all your questions and comments.
segments.cn: 是的，我也希望你访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com，留下你的问题和评论。

segments.en: Marco and I are there every day, so we'll be happy to answer your questions.
segments.cn: 马尔科和我每天都在那儿，所以我们很乐意回答你的问题。

segments.en: But until next time... Bye!
